title: Crypto lender Abra to return money in Texas settlement
description:
Bill Barhydt confirmed the settlement, emphasizing that Abra “has never (ever) frozen withdrawals for U.S. users” and “voluntarily wound down” the Earn and Boost programs in 2023.

Crypto lending firm Abra, allegedly insolvent since March 2023, entered a settlement in principle with the Texas State Securities Board. The company will return assets invested by the state’s citizens. 

On Jan. 22, the Texas State Securities Board released the final confirmation of the settlement. According to it, Abra “began winding down U.S. retail operations” and will now notify clients with more than $10 balances so they can withdraw their assets in seven days. The unclaimed assets will be converted to fiat currency and directed to remaining Texas investors.

Abra is a group of companies controlled by crypto entrepreneur Bill Barhydt. The settlements name four separate entities tied to the brand: Plutus Financial Holdings Inc., Plutus Financial Inc., Plutus Lending LLC, and Abra Boost LLC.

Read more

title: ‘Doomsday Clock’ calls AI existential threat, “disruptive technology” to humankind
description:
AI joins nuclear threats and climate change as a key concern on the Doomsday Clock, highlighting its potential global impact and risks.

The infamous “Doomsday Clock” was updated on Jan. 23 by atomic scientists to reflect the planet’s imminent danger, set only 90 seconds from midnight due to an array of factors, including artificial intelligence (AI). 

The clock is set based on “existential risks” to the planet and humankind, which include nuclear threats, climate change and disruptive technologies. Midnight on the clock represents an “apocalyptic” state, therefore the 90 mark was deemed this year as, “a moment of historic danger.”

It mentions corruption of information, enabled by AI as a potentially important factor in preventing the world from dealing with other urgent threats, along with AI increasingly being used by the military and information operations.

Read more

title: Edward Snowden says ‘privacy is not a crime’ — asks support for Tornado Cash legal defense
description: Snowden asked his followers to pitch in to help Storm, who is currently facing charges for his part in creating Tornado Cash.

title: SEC Commissioner Says ETH ETFs May See Approval Without Going to Court
description:
